comments.body:
Minor stuff: there should be an empty line after line 50, otherwise the docstring can't be parsed properly by Sphinx.

Also applicable for line 72, 86, 103, 135

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +55,59 @@        Run Presto query on athena with provided config and return submitted query_execution_id

        :param query: Presto query to run
        :type query: str
        :param query_context: Context in which query need to be run

comments.body: This line is never going to run because you have `self.conn = None` in the constructor!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +48,52 @@        """
        if not self.conn:
            self.conn = self.get_client_type('athena')
        return self.conn

comments.body:
I'm not sure this try/finally is useful - it looks to me like it would hide possibly useful errors behind and make them all un-discoverable which makes debugging hard.

Either log, or (I think) better just let the exception be thrown!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +87,91 @@            self.log.error('Exception while getting query state', ex)
        finally:
            return state

    def get_query_results(self, query_execution_id):

```
    def stop_query(self, query_execution_id):

```

Need a blank line above this.

https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/#id17
>Multi-line docstrings consist of a summary line just like a one-line docstring, followed by a blank line, followed by a more elaborate description.
